title: Multi Bintang First-Half Profit Climbs on Lager, Premium Beer Sales
body: Multi Bintang’s H1 revenue jumps 6% to Rp1.47t, fueled by lager dominance, premium brand growth, and digital transformation efforts.

title: President Prabowo Orders State Firm Overhaul, Ends Lavish Payouts
body: Prabowo orders sweeping SOE reforms, cutting bloated boards and banning bonuses for loss-making firms to boost state revenue.

title: Indonesia Aims for 5.4 Pct Growth Next Year, No Deficit by 2028
body: Prabowo says that he will continue his budget austerity measures to keep the deficit at 2.48 percent of GDP in 2026.

title: JCI Hits Record High as Prabowo Delivers First State Address
body: Jakarta stocks hit 8,000 intraday for first time as Prabowo pledges growth, attacks corporate greed in debut state address.

title: Prabowo Touts $1 Trillion Danantara Fund as Job-Creation Engine
body: The president also claimed that unemployment has dropped to its lowest level since the 1998 Asian financial crisis.

title: ‘Life is Plastic’: US is Biggest Buyer of Indonesian Toys
body: About 60 percent of Indonesia's toy exports go to the US.

title: Indonesia’s CPO Sector Eyes Strong Finish to 2025 on Price Gains and EU Market Access
body: Global CPO prices have topped $1,000 per ton throughout this year and are expected to climb to $1,100.

title: OJK Dissolves Two Jiwasraya Pension Funds Amid Ongoing Liquidation
body: Jiwasraya -- along with fellow state insurer Asabri -- has been at the center of high-profile corruption and mismanagement scandals.

title: Indonesia Launches Independence Day Shopping Festival to Revive Retail Sales During Low Season
body: The festival offers discounts of up to 80 percent at malls across the nation.

title: From Growth Engine to Vulnerable Group: Indonesia’s Middle Class in Retreat
body: The number of Indonesians classified as middle class dropped from 57.33 million in 2019 to 47.85 million in 2024.

title: Indonesia Still Has No Plans to Import Rice: Gov't
body: Indonesia's rice reserves currently reach 4.3 million tons, according to Deputy Agriculture Minister Sudaryono.

title: Danantara Weighs Land Options for Indonesian Hajj Village Project
body: Sovereign fund Danantara’s boss Rosan Roeslani has traveled to Mecca to get the ball rolling on Indonesia’s Hajj Village plan.

title: From Post Office to Brewery: A Look at the Oldest Firms in Indonesia
body: While most companies last only 40–50 years, these Indonesian firms have thrived for over a century, weathering history’s biggest challenges.

title: KAI Appoints Bobby Rasyidin as CEO in Line With New SOE Law
body: KAI appoints Bobby Rasyidin as president director in a major leadership reshuffle to boost strategy, innovation, and service quality.

title: ADB Approves $500 Million Loan for Indonesia to Improve Tax Collection
body: ADB's policy-based loan comes at a time when Jakarta struggles with its annual tax target and its relatively new Coretax system.

title: Luhut to Meet US Commerce Secretary in September for Tariff Talks
body: Indonesia’s Luhut will meet US Commerce Secretary Lutnick in September to seek tariff relief on key exports hit by Trump’s 19% duties.

title: Energy, Minerals Add $8.6 Billion to Indonesia’s Non-Tax Revenue
body: Mineral resources and coal contribute Rp 74.2 trillion to Indonesia's non-tax revenue in the first half of 2025.

title: Bahlil Inspects $963 Million Floating LNG Facility Being Built for West Papua Gas Field
body: The FLNG unit will process gas from the Asap Kido Merah field in Teluk Bintuni Regency, West Papua, operated by Genting Oil Kasuri Limited.

title: Bank Indonesia Denies Payment ID Will Invade Personal Privacy
body: Bank Indonesia says its Payment ID system will track sector trends, not individuals, and will comply with Indonesia’s data protection law.

title: Bank Indonesia Denies Payment ID Will Invade Personal Privacy
body: Bank Indonesia says its Payment ID system will track sector trends, not individuals, and will comply with Indonesia’s data protection law.

title: Erajaya Books $36 Million Profit in First Half of 2025 on Strong Smartphone Sales
body: The company recently entered into a strategic partnership with Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng.

title: Indonesia’s Free Nutritious Meal Program Reaches 15 Million Beneficiaries at $504 Million Cost
body: The next target is to establish 14,000 additional kitchens to expand the program’s reach.

title: Indonesia Could Raise $5 Billion by Taxing Its 50 Wealthiest Citizens, Study Says
body: The study estimated that around 22,000 people in Indonesia qualify as “super rich” and could contribute significantly to state revenues.

title: Trump Backs Down, Grants China Another 90-Day Trade Reprieve
body: “The US has realized it does not have the upper hand,’’ said Claire Reade, former assistant US trade representative for China affairs.

title: Pertamina Launches World-Leading Green Jet Fuel with Highest Vegetable Oil Content
body: Pertamina Patra Niaga has three sustainable aviation fuel distribution facilities that have received international certification.

title: Indonesia, Canada to Sign Trade Pact This Year
body: Indonesia will see a trade liberalization of up to 90.5 percent of the total tariffs for goods entering the Canadian market.

title: Peru to Drop Tariffs on Nearly All Indonesian Imports, Including Palm Oil
body: Indonesia’s top export palm oil is set to have its tariffs dropped to 0 percent when being sold to Peru.

title: French Dairy Company Bel Buys 22.5% of Cheese Maker Mulia Boga Raya
body: French dairy giant Bel S.A. takes 22.5% of KEJU for $44M, eyeing Indonesia’s low per-capita cheese market and rising middle-class demand.

title: Indonesia’s Truck Makers Sound Alarm Over Duty-Free Chinese Imports
body: Indonesian coachbuilders warn that duty-free Chinese truck imports are eroding market share and threatening local manufacturing.

title: Palm Oil Biodiesel Helps Indonesia Save $3.68 Billion in Foreign Exchange
body: World's largest palm oil Indonesia manages to cut its fuel imports by adding the food crop to its fuel.

title: Indonesia’s H1 Energy, Mineral Investments Hit Record High at $13.9 Billion
body: Investments in the Indonesian energy and mineral resources sectors have soared 24.1 percent year-on-year in the first half of 2025.

title: Danantara’s Food Unit CEO Steps Down After 6 Months, Cites Zero Budget Support
body: Danantara’s Food Unit CEO Steps Down, Cites Zero Budget Support

title: IDX Eyes $1.2 Trillion Market Cap by 2029 to Join Top 10 Biggest Stock Exchange
body: Indonesia’s bourse plans to lift market cap 50% to $1.2T by 2029, aiming to break into the world’s top 10 exchanges.

title: It Takes Just 14 Months for Indonesia and Peru to Adopt Trade Pact
body: Peru calls Indonesia as its sixth-largest trading partner in Asia as the two countries wrapped up a trade deal in just 14 months.

title: Veteran Central Banker Ricky Gozali Joins Bank Indonesia Leadership
body: Before his appointment, Ricky served as Head of Bank Indonesia’s Jakarta Representative Office.

title: Holiday Travel and Festive Season Boost Mobility, Fueling Q2 Economic Expansion
body: BPS figures indicate that domestic tourist trips rose 22.32 percent year-on-year to 331.37 million visits during the quarter.

title: Danantara Denies Deal with Sentul City to Develop Medical Special Economic Zone
body: All strategic investment plans at Danantara undergo a rigorous governance process and comprehensive feasibility review, Pandu said.

title: BPS Chief Details Household Spending, Exports Behind Strong Q2 Growth
body: Household consumption remains the backbone of the economy, contributing 54.25 percent to overall growth in the quarter.

title: Prabowo Sends Kadin Leaders to Magelang Retreat, Calls for Inclusive Growth
body: Prabowo sends 230 Kadin leaders to Magelang retreat, urging support for small businesses and inclusive growth to boost national prosperity.
